snippet: A complaint from civil rights groups over a single test used to screen applicants to New York City’s elite public schools was overdue.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's dismissive response to complaint filed by coalition of civil rights groups over admissions policies at city's eight 'specialized' high schools; contends complaint, which charges city with illegally screening out minority applicants based on single test, should be taken seriously and not be brushed aside.
lead_paragraph: A complaint from civil rights groups over a single test used to screen applicants to New York City’s elite public schools was overdue.
